bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: The Ivo Pogorelich International Solo Piano Competition was established in 1993 with the "goal of perpetuating the art of the solo pianist at the highest level of excellence." The competition was to take place every three years beginning in the year 1993. The competition was organized in three stages: Stage I presented 40 competitors; Stage II presented 12 competitors; Stage III presented 6 competitors. Ivo Pogorelich personally designated the Ambassador Auditorium to be the site of all stages of the competition "because of its beauty, exceptional acoustics and intimate ambience." The first Ivo Pogorelich International Solo Piano Competition took place December 1-16, 1993, and the performances of the competitors were recorded. Audio cassette recordings of these performances are housed in Box 679 and Box 680 of this collection.
Due to the closing of the Ambassador Auditorium in May 1995, the Ivo Pogorelich International Solo Piano Competition did not continue after 1993.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: These audio recordings are boxed together with Ambassador promotional and demo audio cassette tapes (the two groups of materials have been clearly separated within the box). For a description of the promotional/demo tapes, see Series 1.

scopecontent.head: Contents of Beta tapes
scopecontent.p: Following an attempt to digitize a number of Beta tapes from the Ambassador Auditorium Collection in August 2013, it was established that these tapes contained PCM-F1 digital audio, not moving image material. It is assumed that this is the case for all Beta tapes in the collection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Video cassette tapes are identified by four-digit numbers preceded by the letters SV. The numbers were assigned by the Ambassador organization, and the numbering system generally follows chronological order. In the listing below each Ambassador tape number represents one Beta video cassette unless otherwise noted.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The following tapes are identified by date and other information taken from the container and the cassette. Each date represents one video cassette unless otherwise noted. Some tapes appear to be duplicate copies.

The first 10 tapes listed appear to contain material from the inaugural concerts by the Vienna Symphony Orchestra conducted by Carlo Maria Giulini. Dub dates on the tapes range from 1993 to 1995, but the concerts were held on April 7, 8, and 9, 1974. The exact date of the recordings is unknown.

did.unittitle: Video Cassettes (Betacam SP, Hi8, U-matic, VHS): Performances and Miscellaneous:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contents of 33 Hi8 video cassette tapes are related to the Ivo Pogorelich International Piano Competition. The tapes are dated 11-30-1993 to 12-16-1993 and numbered sequentially from 1 to 33.

Contents of 16 VHS video tapes, 1 U-matic tape and 1 Betacam SP tape are related to Sam Wanamaker, 1991 recipient of the Ambassador Award for Excellence, and his role in the reconstruction of Shakespeare's Globe Theatre in London.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One folder containing paper notes and other items removed from the original film containers and eight film reels wound on cores and stored in archival film cans, numbered and described as follows:
[Folder:] (1) [items removed from film containers]

[Film reels:] (1) 16mm film, [from printed label on original container:] “An Eastin School Film, Instruments of the Orchestra, Eastin Pictures Co., General Office, Davenport, Iowa”; (2) 16mm film, [from handwritten note inside original container:] “Arthur Rubinstein 16mm Film Possible magnetic audio signal Special projector needed to preview”; (3) 16mm film, [from handwritten note on original reel:] “Arthur Rubinstein Lecture at Recital Hall Magnetic audio signal Special projector is needed”; (4) 16mm film, [from handwritten note on original reel:] “Arthur Rubinstein 16mm Film Encores and Presentations January 15, 1975 No audio”; (5) 16mm film, [from label on original container:] “Ambassador College Audio-Visual Department, P.O. Box 111, Pasadena, California, U.S.A. 91109; Title: Ambassador Auditorium Worldwide Church of God Production, Print No. 15B, Footage: 1037, Time: 28’ 48”, color, sound,” [from separate label:] “Permafilm Protected Hollywood,” [from separate handwritten label:] “Not edited, slight scratching at HD - Film in good shape 3-8-82”; (6) 16mm film, [from handwritten note attached to original film container:] “16mm Film Arthur Rubinstein Lecture at Recital Hall [enclosed in a circle:] A”; (7) 35mm film, [from handwritten label on original container:] "Rubinstein Encores P 5118 Presentation 35/32 TRK,” [from handwritten note inside container:] “Optical audio signal 35mm format Needs special projector”; (8) 16mm film, [from handwritten label on original container:] “Rubinstein Encores, 5118 Pres. - 16mm Neg, PSP20 - 78 F.O.T. Spanish,” [from handwritten note inside container:] “Audio Signal of Recital Hall lecture Arthur Rubinstein”

odd.head: General
odd.p: These eight film reels were originally located in three separate boxes and housed in various types of containers. Some reels show signs of deterioration (vinegar syndrome). The reels were wound onto archival cores and rehoused in plastic film cans at the Stanford Media Preservation Lab. The film cans were then consolidated in Box 608. The following is a complete description of the film reels and their original containers that was created before this preservation work took place:
1. 16mm film reel in metal can with printed label: “An Eastin School Film, Instruments of the Orchestra, Eastin Pictures Co., General Office, Davenport, Iowa” [vinegar syndrome] (removed from Box 86)
2. 16mm film reel in gray plastic can; handwritten note inside: “Arthur Rubinstein 16mm Film Possible magnetic audio signal Special projector needed to preview” (removed from Box 86)
3. 16mm film on brown metal reel with handwritten note on reel: “Arthur Rubinstein Lecture at Recital Hall Magnetic audio signal Special projector is needed” (removed from Box 92)
4. 16mm film on gray plastic reel with handwritten note on reel: “Arthur Rubinstein 16mm Film Encores and Presentations January 15, 1975 No audio” (removed from Box 92)

5. 16mm film reel in brown metal can labeled: “Ambassador College Audio-Visual Department, P.O. Box 111, Pasadena, California, U.S.A. 91109; Title: Ambassador Auditorium Worldwide Church of God Production, Print No. 15B, Footage: 1037, Time: 28’ 48”, color, sound” ; [separate label:] “Permafilm Protected Hollywood” ; [separate handwritten label:] “Not edited, slight scratching at HD - Film in good shape 3-8-82” (removed from Box 92)

6. 16mm film on plastic core inside padded mailing envelope in cardboard mailer; handwritten note attached to film: “16mm Film Arthur Rubinstein Lecture at Recital Hall [enclosed in a circle:] A” (in Box 608)

7. 35mm film on plastic core in 11” x 11” square metal container; container labeled [handwritten]: Rubinstein Encores P 5118 Presentation 35/32 TRK” ; handwritten note in box: “Optical audio signal 35mm format Needs special projector” [possible vinegar syndrome?] (in Box 608)

8. 16mm film on metal reel in 11” x 11” square metal container; container labeled [handwritten]: “Rubinstein Encores, 5118 Pres. - 16mm Neg, PSP20 - 78 F.O.T. Spanish” ; inside container, handwritten note on film reel: “Audio Signal of Recital Hall lecture Arthur Rubinstein” [vinegar syndrome] (in Box 608)
